info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 28 at 10:57AM PDT until March 28 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING ABOVE 3000 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Above 3000 feet, heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Between 2000 and 3000 feet, snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, and 2 to 4 inches near Sawyers Bar west of Etna. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph over high and exposed terrain. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, Western Siskiyou County above 3000 west and south of the Scott Valley, including higher portions of Sawyers Bar Road. For the Winter Weather Advisory, this includes areas between 2000 and 3000 feet, including Seiad Valley, Scott Bar, Fort Jones, Etna, and Callahan. This also includes lower portions of Sawyers Bar Road, portions of Highway 3 from Fort Jones southwest and Highway 96 between Klamath River and Happy Camp. * WHEN...Until 11 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow is expected late this evening through early afternoon. Snowfall rates could approach 1 inch per hour in the warning area into early afternoon. Snow will decrease later this afternoon then increase again Tuesday evening. The combination of strong winds and snow will result in reduced visibilities and occasional whiteout conditions. Lowering snow levels this morning could result in snow below 2000 feet along Highway 96 south of Happy Camp. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent, or likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
